description:
Mitsuha Miyamizu, a high school girl, yearns to live the life of a boy in the bustling city of Tokyo—a dream that stands in stark contrast to her present life in the countryside. Meanwhile in the city, Taki Tachibana lives a busy life as a high school student while juggling his part-time job and hopes for a future in architecture.

One day, Mitsuha awakens in a room that is not her own and suddenly finds herself living the dream life in Tokyo—but in Taki's body! Elsewhere, Taki finds himself living Mitsuha's life in the humble countryside. In pursuit of an answer to this strange phenomenon, they begin to search for one another.

Kimi no Na wa. revolves around Mitsuha and Taki's actions, which begin to have a dramatic impact on each other's lives, weaving them into a fabric held together by fate and circumstance.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: Your Name. - Gestern, heute und für immer
หลับตาฝันถึงชื่อเธอ

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

node.description:
__[Website](http://www.shinkaiworks.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shinkaimakoto)__

A Japanese director, writer, producer, animator, editor, cinematographer, voice actor, manga artist, and former graphic designer. He is best known for directing _Kimi no Na wa_, and was listed by Variety as one of 10 animators to watch in 2016. However, he was displeased with the amount of attention and wide recognition the film got, as he felt that it was unfinished.

Asteroid 55222 Makotoshinkai is named after him.

__[Website](http://www.shinkaiworks.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shinkaimakoto)__

A Japanese director, writer, producer, animator, editor, cinematographer, voice actor, manga artist, and former graphic designer. He is best known for directing _Kimi no Na wa_, and was listed by Variety as one of 10 animators to watch in 2016. However, he was displeased with the amount of attention and wide recognition the film got, as he felt that it was unfinished.

Asteroid 55222 Makotoshinkai is named after him.

[Website](http://mateuszurbanowicz.com)

Currently works as a digital creator (mainly animation background art) at Comix Wave Films animation studio in Tokyo. He's done various illustration works for books and comics and also conducted many courses in using Adobe and Corel applications with Wacom graphics tablets in co-operation with WACOM Germany and Corel Poland. He has a diploma of a technician in computer networks and systems.

Hamasu's animation mainly focuses on character acting, and his scenes often feature minimal camerawork with a heavy emphasis on expressive facial and body animation. Much like [Kouichi Arai](https://anilist.co/staff/121208/), he was heavily influenced by [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/) and the late '80s realism. Early in his career he was employed at Toei Animation, and was thus a recurring presence in the studio's OVA works such as [Xanadu](https://anilist.co/anime/5920/), [Crying Freeman](https://anilist.co/anime/1153/) and [Vampire Wars](https://anilist.co/anime/1765/). His rising prominence during the early '90s allowed him to participate on [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), and from thereon he has been in high demand for feature films.

In 1993, Hamasu animated the car chase on [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/)’s episode of the [JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/666/). The scene impressed Kon enough for Hamasu to end up as a character designer and animation director on [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/). He was also set to serve a similar role in [Millennium Actress](https://anilist.co/anime/1033/), but was replaced in the role by [Takeshi Honda](https://anilist.co/staff/103303/) due to having contracted a severe tendon inflammation. He appeared on all of Kon’s films, as well as [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/) until the director's passing.

More recently he has mostly worked on [Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) and [Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/)'s films.

RADWIMPS is a Japanese alternative rock band formed in Kanagawa, Japan.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/radwimps.official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/radwimps_jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/radwimps) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/radwimpsstaff) | [Website](https://radwimps.jp/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/賀川愛)

Originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), affiliated with [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) since its founding.

When she heard they were looking for staff for [Nausicaä](https://anilist.co/anime/572/), she asked someone at Doga Kobo who had connections to get her in because she was a big fan of [Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/)'s. She has since then been one of the lead animators in almost every single Ghibli film.

For her first job she drew the scene of Nausicaä listening to Yupa in Jiru's room, and also Nausicaä trying to save the old men in barge, and Nausicaä pushing the gunship to its limit near the end. In [Kiki](https://anilist.co/anime/512/) she drew over 50 shots of Kiki and Ursula at the log house. In [Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/) she drew the scene where the wolf is rescued from under the boars. In [Whisper of the Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/585/) she drew the scene that takes place in the rain. In [Spirited Away](https://anilist.co/anime/199/), she wanted to participate more as an animator, but was told to help out animation director [Masashi Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/106978/) after only having drawn a little animation, namely the scene at the beginning where Sen walks out of the tunnel. In [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/) she was able to come back full force as an animator. In films since then she has occasionally taken part as an animation director, but mostly as an animator.

(Source: [Pelleas](http://www.pelleas.net/aniTOP/index.php/title_34))

__[Website](http://www.shinkaiworks.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shinkaimakoto)__

__[Website](http://www.shinkaiworks.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shinkaimakoto)__

A Japanese director, writer, producer, animator, editor, cinematographer, voice actor, manga artist, and former graphic designer. He is best known for directing _Kimi no Na wa_, and was listed by Variety as one of 10 animators to watch in 2016. However, he was displeased with the amount of attention and wide recognition the film got, as he felt that it was unfinished.

Asteroid 55222 Makotoshinkai is named after him.

__Eiko Morikawa__ is a Japanese sound effects editor. She started working at Swara Production, then went to Rakuonsha, and now is the representative director of Chura Sound.

(Source: AniDB)
Youko Miki does color design and photography.
